LIST.trust: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

units.name: Burns ITU
units.locDescriptionOf:
E220 - Burns ITU is located on Level 2 in Zone E.
From the Main Entrance continue ahead along the corridor through the atrium.
Turn right at the fork to enter Zone E.
Continue down the corridor until you reach the bank of lifts on the left.
Take the lift to Level 2.
Exit the lift lobby to the right and continue ahead.
E220 - Burns ITU will be in front of you.
units.bestEntrance: Burns ITU is via the Main Entrance - Zone A.

units.name: E226 - General Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf:
Zone E, 2nd floor, room 26.

E226 - General Intensive Care Unit is located on Level 2 in Zone E.
From the Main Entrance proceed ahead through the atrium corridor.
Turn right at the fork to enter Zone E.
Continue down the corridor to the bank of lifts located on the left.
Take the lift to Level 2.
Exit the lift lobby to the left and continue down the corridor. General Intensive Care Unit will be on the left.

LIST.trust: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

units.name: Critical care
units.locDescriptionOf: Level A, Middle Block
units.otherUseful:
Enter the hospital via the main entrance and continue ahead, following the corridor to the right.
There is a level change via a ramp to overcome the steps, just beyond the right turn.
Continue ahead to the lifts on the left.
Take a lift to level A.
On exiting the lift, turn right and follow the corridor to the Critical Care Unit on the right.

units.name: Colne Ward
units.locDescriptionOf: Level C, Cardiothoracic Centre
units.otherUseful:
Enter via the Cardiothoracic Centre - Accessible Entrance.
Continue ahead to the 22A and 22B lifts.
Take the lifts to Level C.
Exit the lifts and go to the right, follow the corridor ahead.
The Colne Ward is on the right.

LIST.trust: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

units.name: Adult Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: 1st floor main building. Dedicated staff lift can be taken from ED  to first floor, turn right out of lift and follow corridor

LIST.trust: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

units.name: Adult Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf:
5th floor, lift B via main entrance. 

5th floor via core lift via ED ambulance entrance

units.name: Burns Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf:
5th floor, lift B via main entrance. 

5th floor via core lift via ED ambulance entrance
units.otherUseful: Burns ICU is managed by the adult ICU team - entrance will be via ICU if using ambulance lift. Please avoid main entrance lift B as public lift - if used turn right out of lift.

units.name: ITU
units.locDescriptionOf: Enter through main entrance and walk past Costa on left hand side. Turn right at the 'T junction'. Follow corridor and take lift on your right hand side to 1st floor. Exit the lift and walk back in the direction you came from and ITU will be on your left, as ITU is directly above the 'T junction' you turned at on the ground floor by the Costa.

units.name: Edison Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf:
*easiest*(level 3) A+E continue straight until past double doors leaving A+E first left and first left again to Lifts (Level 5) Turning left and then first right to Edison ITU.
*alternatively*(level 4) main entrance walk past reception taking first turn Left to Lifts (Level 5)  Turning left and then first right to Edison ITU.
units.otherUseful:
A+E
020 8869 -
- 3088 - Main Reception (long waits)
- 2271 - Dr desk A+E (quick)
- 2028 - Nursing central desk 
- 2108 - NIC desk

units.name: GICU
units.locDescriptionOf:
St James Wing 
1st floor
units.otherUseful:
Ambulance entrance ED


Outreach Registrar Bleep 8772

units.name: CTICU ( Cardiac ICU)
units.locDescriptionOf: Atkinson Morley Wing
units.otherUseful:
Atkinson Morley 1st Floor 
Left side on exit from elevator


For Cath lab
Cardiac-Blue call HAC-020 872 54911, primary PCI ext 4911

units.name: North
units.locDescriptionOf: 2nd floor, turn right out of the lifts, north is on the right and south is on the left
units.nic: Call direct ward number above or bleep = 2807

units.name: South
units.locDescriptionOf: 2nd floor, right out of lifts, north on the right and south on the left at end of the corridor

LIST.trust: Guyâs and St Thomasâ NHS Foundation Trust

units.name: Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: Call the nurse in charge and they will open the back gates of the unit and you can park there.

units.name: GITU
units.locDescriptionOf: Enter via ED Resus entrance. Proceed down corridor and turn right. Proceed past Resus on your right. Continue around the corner, walk past Neuro ITU and GITU will be the next unit on the right

units.name: Neuro ITU
units.locDescriptionOf: Enter via ED Resus entrance. Proceed down corridor and turn right. Proceed past Resus on your right. Continue around the corner. First unit on the right will be NITU

units.name: Adult Intensive Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: Level 9 Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother Building
units.bestEntrance: Main entrance for the most direct route to lifts. Or ED but have to walk through ED to get to lifts.
units.otherUseful: Can operate lifts without passes but if you can find a staff member with priority access, you will get a direct run to ICU.

units.name: Enhanced Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: Main entrance second right following signage third door on left
units.otherUseful: Nil Consultant / Reg on unit will need to call in advance to have them come down and meet staff.

units.name: Enhanced Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: Main entrance second right following signage third door on left

units.name: ICU A/B/C
units.locDescriptionOf:
First floor main hospital
Enter from rear entrance:
Use ramps to reach 1st floor, turn left at top of ramp and CCU is directly in front of you

Enter from ED/main entrance:
Join main hospital corridor, use lifts to reach 1st floor and CCU is directly in front of you
9th floor
units.bestEntrance: QEQM during daylight hours, ED Resus 24 hours

units.locDescriptionOf: 9th floor

units.name: ICU
units.locDescriptionOf:
If entering by ambulance bay: enter through ED, follow signs for orange zone. Take bed lifts to 3rd floor

If entering via main or endoscopy entrance: enter the main hospital street, follow signs for orange zone. Take bed lifts to 3rd floor

units.name: HDU
units.locDescriptionOf:
If entering by ambulance bay: enter through ED, follow signs for orange zone. Take bed lifts to 3rd floor

If entering via main or endoscopy entrance: enter the main hospital street, follow signs for orange zone. Take bed lifts to 3rd floor

units.name: Critical Care South
units.locDescriptionOf: Main Hospital, first floor,  Blue corridor.

units.name: Critical Care North
units.locDescriptionOf: Main Hospital, First floor, Blue corridor

units.name: T3
units.otherUseful: Pass resus, and double doors then lifts will be on the right. Lifts are not able to operate without ID batch. Where the lifts are there is a door if you knock the porters will be sat there and they can get a lift for you. Otherwise they will be located in the 4th floor lobby.

units.name: PACU
units.locDescriptionOf: Same as the tower just different floors
units.otherUseful:
Same as the previous one. Same building

This is a post Anaesthestic ICU

units.name: Acute Intensive Care Unit (AICU)
units.locDescriptionOf: Main entrance via Sydney street leads into Sydney wing. Veer to left and follow main corridor round to lift area, take lift to level 3 (ground floor is called level 2, basement level 1!). Either go directly through double doors labelled theatres (AICU on the right) or follow signs in opposite direction to a second entrance labelled as AICU.
units.bestEntrance: Via main sydney street entrance. ICU is best entered via a lobby which also leads to main theatres.
units.otherUseful: ECMO unit. 2 consultants manage in tandem at all times, contact directly via switch.

units.name: Elizabeth HDU
units.locDescriptionOf:
Based on level 5, Sydney Wing

Able to take level 2 patients or level 3 patients if no other local capacity.
units.otherUseful: Managed separately to adult ICU so has a different consultant contactable via switch

units.name: 1C
units.locDescriptionOf:
First floor, King George V (KGV) wing
Enter via the aortic dissection entrance, take lift core F immediately in front of you via the double doors to the first floor and turn left following the signs for 1C
units.bestEntrance: Aortic dissection entrance in square, far side from the HAC service
units.otherUseful: Fast track cardiac surgery unit, takes some emergency cardiac / thoracic surgical admissions

units.name: 1D
units.locDescriptionOf:
First floor, King George V (KGV) wing
Enter via the aortic dissection entrance, take lift core F immediately in front of you via the double doors to the first floor and turn left following the signs for 1D
units.bestEntrance: Aortic dissection entrance in square, far side from the HAC service
units.otherUseful: Step down HDU cardiac surgery unit, accepts some emergency thoracic surgical admissions

units.name: PRUH ICU
units.locDescriptionOf: First floor via lifts beyond patient information desk

units.bestEntrance: Ambulance ramp entrance. Same side as ME.

units.name: Liver ITU
units.locDescriptionOf: Cheyne Wing
units.bestEntrance: Ambulance ramp entrance. Same side as ME.

LIST.trust: Whipps Cross University Hospital; Barts health Trust

units.name: ICU 1
units.locDescriptionOf: Ground floor, Junction 10, across from ICU 2
units.otherUseful:
Main entrance- one long straight walk.
Park in Resus ambulance bays- no lifts, but a more complicated walk and a walk through ED. 
Park on Ambulance Rd and come up the lift by Victory Ward.

units.name: ICU 2
units.locDescriptionOf: Ground floor, Junction 10, across from ICU 1
units.otherUseful:
Main entrance- one long straight walk.
Park in Resus ambulance bays- no lifts, but a more complicated walk and a walk through ED. 
Park on Ambulance Rd and come up the lift by Victory Ward.

units.name: Adult Critical Care Unit
units.locDescriptionOf: Located on wards 4E and 4F, 4th floor, south tower, of the Royal London Hospital.
